results.title: Strength training for sport
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Isaacs, Paul Foxall and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”
The explosion of new athletic records has largely come about through strength training. The training program must strengthen all muscle groups. The various strength training techniques and exercises are demonstrated by top athletes.

results.title: Strength of the land
results.creator_credit: Alan Bateman, Geoffrey Barnes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This video follows the King of Thailand, Bhumibol Adulyadej, through his many personal and public activities, including his interest in science, agricultural engineering, the arts, and his tours of his country. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: Streisand: my name is Barbra
results.creator_credit: Richard Lewine, Ellbar Productions, CBS Television and Dwight Hemion
results.brief_description: Following her success in “Funny girl”, Barbra Streisand participated in this Emmy award winning debut television special. The program has the Streisand trademark on it, with an entertaining collection of songs, storytelling, and satire. Song renditions include “People” (from “Funny girl”), “My man”, “How does the wine taste”, “Lover come back” and “We could make believe”. Dynamic performances in a schoolgirl skit, the energetic “Second hand rose” and the classic finale of “Happy days are here again” are well received by her captive audience, and no doubt by viewers watching at home.

results.title: Strega Nonna (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Animated version of a traditional Calabrian tale, retold and illustrated by Tomi de Paola about Strega Nonna the Italian Grandmother witch who cures headaches, secures husbands and banishes warts. Among her magic secrets is the trick of summoning pasta from her enchanted pot. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Streetwise
results.brief_description: In this series of episodes that advise on self-defence, it is shown how women cope in difficult situations, and experts also comment on how to deal with threatening situations. Episode 1 - Self Defence; Episode 2 - Pick pockets; Episode 3 - Burglars; Episode 4 - Sexual Harassment.

results.title: Streets of Fitzroy [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI and Mick Booth
results.brief_description:
Mick Booth was brought up in Kent Street, Fitzroy - an inner suburb of Melbourne. This is his story of childhood memories, family and growing up in Fitzroy.
In English language with English subtitles.

results.title: Streets are for sharing
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: The film seeks to raise people’s awareness of the range of options available among the competing demands for use of our streets. Residents, pedestrians, cyclists, motorists, transporters, all expect the roadway to meet their demands. The solutions are discussed. Narrated by Colin Taylor and Pat Bishop. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
